subject: A LIFE-AND-DEATH ISSUE
reflection:
Like people since Adam and Eve, we suffer the effects of sin, and death
is certain (Romans 6:23). Yet we can live with hope and joy, because God sent
His Son to die for our sins. Jesus conquered death when He rose from the
grave. And if we receive Him as our personal Savior and Lord, we too can
experience God's forgiveness and look forward to being with Him in heaven
for ever. Have you faced and settled this life-and-death issue?
prayer:
Lord Jesus, thank You for conquering sin and death and
offering forgiveness and everlasting life to all who receive
You. Give me grace to face this life-and-death issue with
faith—trusting Your cross and resurrection—and fill me with
living hope and joy. Secure my heart in You today, and keep
me ready for the day I see You face to face. Amen. (AI)

subject: THE RIGHT FOCUS
reflection:
We call Life's older years the "sunset years." Or "the
golden years." For some they are. But for many others, even
Christians, the "sunset years" often turn into bitterness
and despair. As I have noticed contented older people, I
have learned that it is our focus more than our feelings
that determine the sort of people we are. One time an
elderly lady told me that "old age is not for sissies!." But
her groans turned into praise for God. What is your focus
today, regardless of your feelings? Is it one of gratitude
for Jesus and His gift of eternal life? If so, you'll grow
sweeter as you grow older. What you will be tomorrow depends
on the choices you make today.
prayer:
Faithful Lord, fix my focus on You in every season,
especially in my sunset years. Trade bitterness for
gratitude, fear for hope, and groans for praise as I
remember Jesus and His gift of eternal life. Shape my
choices today so that I grow sweeter, wiser, and more like
Christ tomorrow. Amen. (AI)

subject: CALL 91:1
reflection:
The phone numbers 9-1-1 in the United Sates will get you in
touch with emergency help. Its so simple even preschoolers
know what it is for, and how to use it. Often many
situations we find ourselves in cannot be remedied by human
restores. Many of our crises require divine assistance. When
that happens, we can call a different kind of 9-1-1 ---
Psalm 91:1. There we will find the help and protection of
the Almighty God. When we face the crises of life, we often
try to survive on our own. We forget that what we need most,
is God's protection and the comfort of His presence, which
are available for the asking. We need not faer life's dark
shadows when we abide under the shadow of God's wings.
prayer:
Lord God, thank You for being our refuge and strength, our
shelter in times of trouble as Psalm 91:1 assures us. Help
us to dwell continually under Your protective shadow,
trusting fully in Your mighty care. When life's storms come,
may we find comfort and peace in Your presence, knowing You
are our ever-present help and protector. Amen. (AI)

subject: KEEP GOING FOR GOD
reflection:
A familiar saying goes something like this: "Old age is a
matter of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't
matter!" Dr's. tell us to stay active as long as we can. but
far to many folks hit middle age and put the body in
neutral. It seems that many Christians too often put their
service for Jesus Christ in the same inactive mode. Each of
us has a responsibility to God, as long as He gives us
physical and mental strength, to work heartily "as working
for the Lord" (Colossians 3:23). The Psalmist said that the
righteous "will still bear fruit in old age" (Psalm 92:14).
Lets make sure that old age doesn't stop us from bearing
fruit. We need to keep going for God.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your promise in Psalm 92:14
that the righteous will still bear fruit in old age,
remaining fresh, green, and full of life. Help us to
continue serving You diligently with the strength and wisdom
You provide, no matter our age. May our lives always reflect
Your righteousness and bring glory to Your name as we
steadfastly follow You. Amen. (AI)

subject: THE TRUE OWNER
reflection:
It is easy to take for granted all the material and
spiritual blessing that God has given us. That's why we need
to stop and remember that Scripture says the true owner of
all we possess is God's: "Everything in heaven and earth is
yours. Yours, Lord, is the kingdom: You are exalted as head
over all" (1 Corinthians 29:11). Even our bodies do not belong to
us. You are not your own; you were bought with a price. We
are so abundantly blessed with good thing! Let us never take
our heavenly Father for granted, but use wisely and
gratefully all that He has given us. God gives blessings to
us so we can give glory to Him.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, we acknowledge that everything in heaven
and earth belongs to You, including our very lives and all
we possess. Help us to live with grateful hearts, using
wisely all that You have entrusted to us for Your glory.
Teach us to remember that we are stewards, not owners, and
to honor You in every area of our lives with the blessings
You generously provide. Amen. (AI)

subject: ONLY FOR HIM
reflection:
Many think our Godward actions such as: prayer, singing,
worship and reading Scriptures, are done as safety devices
to prevent the Lord from zapping us. When we think of God
that way, we will have wrong motives for any God-directed
action. That kind of thinking leads us to pray and worship
God for personal gain or approval. Our worship of the Lord
is not done so we can somehow benefit. Instead, every
heavenward thought or action should be done out of honor for
Him and His greatness. Sure, we benefit when we turn our
attention to God, but that should not be our motivation. It
is not for us we worship God. It should always be for Him.
We don't worship God to gain His benefits--we already have
them.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, may all our prayers, worship, and praise
flow from a heart that honors Your greatness and worthiness,
not from a desire for what we can gain. Help us to focus on
You, cherishing the relationship we have with You above all
else. May our worship be a true reflection of Your infinite
value and majesty, done solely for Your glory and not our
benefit. Amen. (AI)

subject: MAKE A JOYFUL SHOUT
reflection:
The songwriter of Psalm 100 took his allegiance to the Lord
seriously and wanted others to do the same. When we were
kids, we were told to sit still and be quiet in church.
(right?) But, God's goodness and grace should motivate us to
freely express our love and allegiance to the Lord. We need
to push back the boundaries of restraint and lean what is
means to be expressive in our praise to God. Worship is a
time to focus on our Creator, Redeemer, and Shepherd, and
celebrate what He has done for us.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, may all our prayers, worship, and praise
flow from a heart that honors Your greatness and worthiness,
not from a desire for what we can gain. Help us to focus on
You, cherishing the relationship we have with You above all
else. May our worship be a true reflection of Your infinite
value and majesty, done solely for Your glory and not our
benefit. Amen. (AI)

subject: A NEW RULE
reflection:
The writer of Psalm 102 Knew the importance of prayer. He
knew that God cares for us and wants to hear from us, so
start something new and take at least five minutes each
morning asking for His blessings on the day. The Lord wants
to hear from you in your distress. Your new rule just may
have a big impact on your family or someone close to you.
(remember) Prayer is an acknowledgment of our need for God.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for the assurance that You hear
our prayers and desire to bless our days. Teach us to make
time each morning to pour out our hearts to You, trusting
that You listen and care deeply for every need and distress.
May this daily habit strengthen our faith and positively
impact those around us. Amen. (AI)

subject: BENEFITS OF SERVING THE LORD
reflection:
The east and west can never meet. This is a symbolic
portrait of God's forgiveness. When He forgives our sin, He
separates it from us and doesn't even remember it. We need
not wallow in the ugly past, because God forgives and
forgets. How often have we dredge up the past? But why,
remember God has wiped our record clean. If we intend to
follow God, we must model His forgiveness. When we forgive
others, we must also forget the sin, otherwise we have not
truly forgiven.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your wonderful promise to
forgive and forget our sins, removing them as far as the
east is from the west. Help us to trust that when You
forgive, You no longer hold our past against us, and teach
us to forgive others fully, forgetting their wrongs as You
have forgotten ours. May we live free from the burden of
guilt and bitterness, walking in the joy of Your grace.
Amen. (AI)

subject: BEWARE OF QUICK FIXES
reflection:
How many of us have been guilty of praying only in a crisis.
How many of us have a "Quick fix" mentality that sees God
mainly as a problem solver. And when merciful solutions
come, He is courteously thanked, then more or less forgotten
until the next crisis. If you read Psalm 106: 1-15 you will
see that it contains a serious warning against dismissing
God from our lives--as if that was possible. Anticipate
great things from God, but don't expect Him to come at your
beck and call. Instead, be at His beck and call, eager to
fulfill His will. Ask God to accompany you through life's
dark pathways. But instead of dismissing Him when your
special needs are met, cling to Him as if your life depended
on it. It does! REMEMBER GOD IS NOT A VENDING MACHINE. . .
prayer:
Heavenly Father, help us to remember Your unwavering
faithfulness through all the trials and temptations we face,
just as Your people did in Psalm 106. May we never treat You
as a convenience for quick fixes, but always remain at Your
beck and call, eager to fulfill Your will. Teach us to rely
on You daily, trusting in Your mercy and grace to guide us
through life's dark paths without forgetting to praise You
in all circumstances. Amen. (AI)

But they soon forgot what they had done and did not wait for
His plan to unfold.
original_verse_text:
But they soon forgot what they had done and did not wait for
His plan to unfold.
original_reflection_text:
How many of us have been guilty of praying only in a crisis.
How many of us have a "Quick fix" mentality that sees God
mainly as a problem solver. And when merciful solutions
come, He is courteously thanked, then more or less forgotten
until the next crisis. If you read Psalm 106: 1-15 you will
see that it contains a serious warning against dismissing
God from our lives--as if that was possible. Anticipate
great things from God, but don't expect Him to come at your
beck and call. Instead, be at His beck and call, eager to
fulfill His will. Ask God to accompany you through life's
dark pathways. But instead of dismissing Him when your
special needs are met, cling to Him as if your life depended
on it. It does! REMEMBER GOD IS NOT A VENDING MACHINE. . .

subject: THE NEED OF MERCY
reflection:
Many of us have experienced the pain that David expressed in
Psalm 109. When he was hurt and vulnerable, insensitive
people took advantage of him. Certainly, if he had sinned,
he needed their loving correction. Anyone with the mind of
Christ should not act unmercifully toward a brother or
sister in the body of Christ. Rather, we must "Show Mercy"
(V. 16 NKJV). A hurting person needs a helping hand, not an
accusing finger.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, in times of hurt and betrayal, help us to
respond with mercy and compassion rather than bitterness and
accusation. Grant us the grace to be a support to those who
are vulnerable and hurting, reflecting Christ's love in all
our interactions. Teach us to show mercy as You have shown
to us, bringing healing where there is pain. Amen. (AI)

subject: USING OUR HINDSIGHT
reflection:
I've always thought you can see the hand of God best with
our hindsight. Looking back it is easier to understand why
He placed us in the home that He did; why He brought certain
people and circumstances into and out of our lives. In my
own life, I get a lot of clarity (though not perfect) about
the wise and loving ways of God as I reflect on the ways He
has managed my journey by "What God's have done" (Psalm 92:4).
Looking ahead, though, is not always so clear. Have you ever
had that lost feeling when the road ahead seems twisted,
foggy and scary? Before you move into life's next big
adventure, stop and look into the rear view mirror of days
gone by, and joyfully realize that God meant it when He
said, "Never will I leave you, never will I forsake you." So
we can say with confidence, "The Lord is my helper; I will
not be afraid" (Hebrews 13:5-6) With the promise of God's
presence and help in mind, we can move ahead with utmost
confidence.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your steadfast promise that
You will never leave us nor forsake us, giving us strength
and courage as we face uncertain and difficult paths. Help
us to look back with gratitude on Your faithfulness and to
move forward with confidence, knowing Your presence
accompanies us always. May this assurance calm our fears and
empower us to trust You fully in every circumstance. Amen.
(AI)

subject: HE LIGHTS THE WAY
reflection:
God lights our path when we trust Jesus as our Savior. This
trust may come through a word of exhortation from a fellow
believer. It may be the illumination of God's Word by the
ministry of the Holy Spirit. It may be the calm reassurance
in response to heart felt prayer. Or it may be the
miraculous supply of a special need. Whatever the case, God
sends light when we are engulfed in darkness. Jesus lights
the way in the darkest night.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for being the light that dispels
every darkness in our lives. When we feel overwhelmed or
lost, shine Your guidance and peace upon us, reassuring us
that Jesus is the light of the world who leads us safely
through the darkest nights. May we always turn to You in
faith, trusting Your illumination to light our path. Amen.
(AI)

subject: MISPLACE LOVE
reflection:
Many things strive for our affection, and time, and attention,
and it seems we continually need to evaluate where we're
focusing our lives. Because of this God's people are exhorted
to find their security in Him and not other gods (Jug. 18:13-16).
Jesus reiterated this in His discussion of the commandments:
"Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your
soul and all your mind" (Matthew 22:37). The Lord alone is our
"help and shield" (Psalm 115:9). May we reserve our worship
for Him. God is most worthy of our affection.
prayer:
Lord, turn my heart from every rival love and fix my trust
in You alone—my help and my shield. Teach me to love You
with all my heart, soul, and mind, and to reserve my worship
for You who are worthy above all. Guard my focus, order my
affections, and center my life on Your glory. Amen. (AI)

subject: THANKFUL RESPONSE
reflection:
God is so responsive that you can always reach Him. He bends
down and listens to your voice. This writer’s love for the
Lord had grown because he had experienced answers to his
prayers. If you are discouraged, remember that God is near,
listening carefully to every prayer and answering each one
in order to give you His best. Worship is a thankful
response and not a repayment For what God has done.
prayer:
Near and gracious God, thank You for bending low to hear my
voice and for answering with what is best. When I am
discouraged, remind me that You are close; let my worship be
a grateful response to Your faithful love, not a striving to
repay it. Teach me to trust Your timing and rest in Your
nearness today. Amen. (AI)

subject: HIS UNLIMITED LOVE
reflection:
Have you ever heard someone say, “I can’t think of anything
God has done for me, how can I praise Him?" This psalm gives
two reasons for praising God: first His His unfailing love
toward us, second His faithfulness endures forever. If He
did nothing else for us, He would still be worthy of our
highest praise. God’s salvation is available for all people
who believe in Him, not just the Jews.
prayer:
Faithful God, even when I struggle to see Your works, Your
unfailing love and enduring faithfulness remain. Teach me to
praise You for who You are and for the salvation You offer
to all who believe. Let my heart overflow with gratitude for
Your steadfast mercy today. Amen. (AI)

subject: MAKE IT STICK
reflection:
To hide means to keep. God’s Word in our heart is a
deterrent to sin. This alone should inspire us to memorize
Scriptures. But memorization alone will not keep us from
sin; we must also put it to work in our life; making it a
vital guide to everything we do. To get ahold of Scripture,
let Scripture get ahold of you.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, help Your Word to take deep root in my
heart and mind, not only to be memorized but to be lived and
applied each day. Let Your Scriptures guide my every step,
guarding me from sin and shaping my decisions in Your truth.
May Your Word have hold of me so that I am transformed by
its power and presence. Amen. (AI)

subject: TRUE ROAD MAP
reflection:
The psalmist said that he is a “foreigner here on earth” and
so he needed guidance. Almost any long trip needs a map or a
guide. As we travel through life, the Bible should be our
road map, pointing out safe routes and obstacles to avoid
and our final destination. We must recognize ourselves as
pilgrims, travelers here on earth who need to study God’s
map to learn the way. If we ignore the map we will wonder
aimlessly through life and risk missing our real
destination.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, as pilgrims traveling through this world,
we recognize that we are strangers and sojourners on this
earth, longing for our true home with You in heaven. Guide
us through life using Your Word as our map, directing us
away from the dangers and leading us safely to our eternal
destination. Help us to walk faithfully, trusting in Your
guidance every step of the way. Amen. (AI)

subject: TOTAL ASSURANCE
reflection:
This psalm expresses assurance and hope in God’s protection
day and night. He not only made the hills, but heaven and
earth as well. We should never trust a lessor power than God
Himself. But not only is He all-powerful, He also watches
over us. Nothing diverts or deters Him, we are safe. We
never outgrow our need for God’s unfailing watch over us.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, You are the Creator of heaven and earth,
the One who never sleeps nor slumbers, watching over us day
and night with unwavering care. In Your steadfast
protection, we find safety and peace, knowing that nothing
can deter Your watchful eye. Help us to trust fully in Your
presence, confident that You guard our every step now and
forevermore. Amen. (AI)

subject: INTERCESSORY PRAYER
reflection:
The psalmist was not praying for his own peace and
prosperity, but that of his brothers and friends in
Jerusalem. This is intercessory prayer, prayer on behalf of
others. Too often we are quick to pray for our own needs and
desires but neglect interceding for others. Will you
intercede for someone in need today?
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for the example of intercessory
prayer shown by Your servants throughout Scripture, who
faithfully prayed for others even above their own needs.
Give us a heart like theirs to stand in the gap, lifting up
our brothers and sisters in prayer with love and
persistence. Help us to intercede with faith, trusting that
You hear and respond to the cries of Your people. Amen. (AI)

subject: EVERLASTING ENDURANCE
reflection:
Have you ever known people who were drawn to every new fad
or idea? Such people are unstable and unreliable. The secret
to reliability is trusting in God, because He never changes.
He cannot be shaken by the changes in our world, and He
endures forever. The fads and ideas of our world, and our
world itself, will not. Remember the secret to reliability.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, You are the eternal, unchanging Rock amidst

*Subject for *(8/25/19) *EVERLASTING ENDURANCE *(read Ps. 125)



*Today’s verse:*

*Those who trust in the Lord are as secure as mount Zion,*

*They will not be defeated but will endure forever. *(Ps. 125:1)



*Today’s Thought:*

Have you ever known people who were drawn to every new

fad or idea? Such people are unstable and unreliable. The

secret to reliability *is* trusting in God, because He never

changes. He cannot be shaken by the changes in our world,

and He endures forever. The fads and ideas of our world, and

our world itself, will not. *Remember the secret to reliability. *

*Pastor Al*

subject: GOD DOES GREAT THINGS
reflection:
God’s ability to restore life is beyond our understanding.
Forests burn down and are able to grow back. Broken bones
heal. Even grief is not a permanent condition. Our tears can
be seeds that will grow into a harvest of joy because God is
able to bring good out of tragedy. When burdened by sorrow,
know that your times of grief will end and that you, will
again find joy. So let us pray for patients as well as the
ability to wait. God’s great harvest of joy is coming!
prayer:
Heavenly Father, You are the God who restores and heals,
turning our tears into seeds of joy and hope. In times of
grief and sorrow, grant us patience and the strength to wait
on Your perfect timing, trusting that You bring good out of
tragedy. Fill our hearts with the assurance that a great
harvest of joy is coming, and renew our spirits with Your
peace and comfort. Amen. (AI)

subject: TRUST GOD TO PROVIDE
reflection:
A family without God can never experience the spiritual bond
God brings to relationships. A city without God will crumble
from evil and corruption from the inside. Don’t make the
mistake of leaving God out of your life. If you do, all your
accomplishments will be futile. Make God your highest
priority, and let Him do the building.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, You are the foundation of our lives,
families, and communities. Help us to make You our highest
priority, so that our relationships are grounded in Your
love and strength. Let us build our homes and cities on Your
firm foundation, that they may stand strong against all that
would threaten to divide or destroy. Guide us to honor You
in all we do, trusting in Your power to sustain and bless
us. Amen. (AI)

subject: GOD IS THE TRUE HEAD OF THE HOME
reflection:
In this chapter the Psalmist writes that a good family life
is a reward for following God. The values outlined in God’s
Word include, love, service, honesty, integrity, and prayer.
These help all relationships, and they are especially vital
to the home life. Is your home life heavenly or hectic?
Reading and obeying God’s Word is a good place to start to
make your family all that is should be. God will reward your
devotion to Him with inner peace.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for the blessing of family and
the values Your Word teaches us-love, service, honesty,
integrity, and prayer. Help us to build homes that reflect
Your holiness and peace, where relationships flourish and
Your presence is honored. May our devotion to You bring
inner peace and make our family life truly heavenly. Amen.
(AI)

subject: GOD WILL BRING US THROUGH
reflection:
The people of Israel were persecuted from their earliest
days but never destroyed completely. The same is true of the
church. Christians have faced times of severe persecution,
but the church has never been destroyed. As Jesus said to
Peter, “Now I say to you that you are Peter, and upon this
rock I will build my church, and all the powers of hell will
not conquer it.” (Matthew 16:18) When You face persecution and
discrimination take courage—The church will never be
destroyed. Remember—God will bring us through the tough
times.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for the promise that Your church,
built on the foundation of Jesus Christ as the true Rock,
will never be overcome by the forces of evil or death. In
times of persecution and hardship, grant us courage and
steadfast faith, knowing that You uphold and protect Your
people. Help us to trust in Your unshakable power and
faithfulness to bring us through every trial until we share
in Your eternal victory. Amen. (AI)

has never been destroyed. As Jesus said to Peter, “Now I say to

you that you are Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church,

and all the powers of hell will not conquer it.” (Mt. 16:18) When

You face persecution and discrimination take courage—The church

will never be destroyed.

*Remember—God will bring us through the tough times.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: THE ASSURANCE OF GOD'S FORGIVENESS
reflection:
Keeping a record of sins (or holding a grudge) is like
building a wall between you and another person, which makes
it nearly impossible to talk openly while the wall is there.
God doesn’t keep a record of our sins; when He forgives, He
forgives completely, tearing down any wall between Him and
us. So, we fear (revere) God, making it possible to talk to
Him about anything. When you pray, realize God is holding
nothing against you. His lines of communication are
completely open.
prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank You for Your complete and
unconditional forgiveness, for You do not keep a record of
our sins but erase them entirely. Help us to come to You
with confidence, knowing that Your lines of communication
are always open and that nothing separates us from Your
love. Teach us to live in the freedom of Your grace, boldly
sharing our hearts with You in prayer. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*Lord, if You kept a record of sins, who, O Lord, could ever survive?*

*But you offer forgiveness, that we might learn to fear. *(Ps. 130:3-4)



*Thought for Today:*

Keeping a record of sins (or holding a grudge) is like building a wall

between you and another person, which makes it nearly impossible to

talk openly while the wall is there. God doesn’t keep a record of our

sins; when He forgives, He forgives completely, tearing down any wall

between Him and us. So, we fear (revere) God, making it possible to talk

to Him about anything. When you pray, realize God is holding nothing

against you. *His lines of communication are completely open.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: TRUST AND COMMITMENT
reflection:
Lord, my heart is not proud; my eyes are not haughty. I
don’t concern myself with matters to great or awesome for
me. But I have stilled and quietened myself, just as a small
child is quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is
my soul within me. (Psalm 131:1-2) - (read Psalm 131)
prayer:
Heavenly Father, teach us to have hearts that are humble and
eyes that are not proud, so we do not get caught up in
things too great or overwhelming for us. Like a quiet and
content weaned child, may our souls find peace and rest in
Your loving presence. Help us to hope confidently in You now
and forevermore. Amen. (AI)

*Verse for Today:*

*Lord, my heart is not proud; my eyes are not haughty. I don’t*

*concern myself with matters to great or awesome for me. But*

*I have stilled and quietened myself, just as a small child is*

*quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is my soul within*

*me. *(Ps. 131:1-2)



*Thought for Today:*

Pride results from overvaluing ourselves above others.

It results in restlessness because it makes us dissatisfied

with what we have and concerned about what everyone

else is doing. It keeps us hungering for what others have.

By contrast, humility puts others first and allows us to be

content with God leading our lives. Such contentment

gives us security so that we no longer need to prove our-

selves to others.

*Let humility and trust affect your perspective **and give*

*you the strength and freedom to **serve God and others.*

* Pastor Al*

child is quiet with his mother. Yes, like a small child is
my soul within me.

subject: THE LISTENING PRAYER
reflection: Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that He should be able to make use of us. It may be that one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice we nee to develop. GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Teach me Your way, Lord, that I may rely on_

_Your faithfulness; give me an undivided heart,_

_that I may fear your name. _(Ps. 86:11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Prayer is not a way of making use of God; prayer

is a way of offering ourselves to God in order that

He should be able to make use of us. It may be that

one of our great faults in prayer is that we talk too

much and listen to little. When prayer is at its highest

we should wait in silence for God's voice to us. We

might call this a "listening prayer," and it is a practice

we nee to develop.

GOD SPEAKS THROUGH HIS WORD--TAKE TIME TO LISTEN.
